member.description: Bits required for each one is: one = 1, two = 2, three = 3

member.name: T:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.DataEncodation.EightBitByteEncoder
member.summary: EightBitByte is a bit complicate compare to other encoding. It can accept several different encoding table from global ECI table. For different country, default encoding is different. JP use shift_jis, International spec use iso-8859-1 China use ASCII which is first part of normal char table. Between 00 to 7E Korean and Thai should have their own default encoding as well. But so far I can not find their specification freely online. QrCode.Net will use international standard which is iso-8859-1 as default encoding. And use UTF8 as suboption for any string that not belong to any char table or other encoder.

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Terminate.Terminator.TerminateBites(Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.BitList,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method will create BitList that contain terminator, padding and pad codewords for given datacodewords. Use it to full fill the data codewords capacity. Thus avoid massive empty bits.
member.remarks: ISO/IEC 18004:2006 P. 32 33. Terminator / Bit stream to codeword conversion
member.param: Method will add terminator bits at end of baseList
Num of bits for datacodewords without terminator
Total number of datacodewords for specific version. Receive it under Version/VersionTable
member.returns: Bitlist that contain Terminator, padding and padcodewords

member.remarks: LightBrush will not use by this method, DrawingBrush will only contain DarkBrush part. Use LightBrush to fill background of main uielement for more flexible placement

member.summary: Construct QrCode geometry. It will only include geometry for Dark colour module
member.returns: QrCode dark colour module geometry. Size = QrMatrix width x width

member.summary: Write image file to stream

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.DrawingSize.ModuleSize
member.summary: Module pixel width

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.DrawingSize.CodeWidth
member.summary: QrCode pixel width
Initializes a Encapsulated PostScript renderer.
member.param: DarkColor used to draw Dark modules of the QrCode

LightColor used to draw Light modules and QuietZone of the QrCode. Setting to a transparent color (A = 0) allows transparent light modules so the QR Code blends in the existing background. In that case the existing background should remain light and rather uniform, and higher error correction levels are recommended.

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.WriteToStream(Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.BitMatrix,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Renders the matrix in an Encapsuled PostScript format.
member.param: Size in points (1 inch contains 72 point in PostScript) of a module
Output stream that must be writable

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.OutputHeader(Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.DrawingSize,System.IO.StreamWriter)
member.summary: Outputs the EPS header with mandatory declarations, variable declarations and function definitions.
member.param: Size in points (1 inch contains 72 point in PostScript) of a module

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.OutputBackground(System.IO.StreamWriter)
member.summary: Outputs the background unless it is defined as transparent. The background is used for light modules and quiet zone.

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.DrawSquares(Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.BitMatrix,System.IO.StreamWriter)
member.summary: Draw a square for each dark module

member.summary: Use the 'image' or 'colorimage' PostScript command to render modules

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.OutputFooter(System.IO.StreamWriter)
member.summary: Outputs the mandatory EPS footer.

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.SizeCalculator
member.summary: ISizeCalculation for the way to calculate QrCode's pixel size. Ex for ISizeCalculation:FixedCodeSize, FixedModuleSize

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.DarkColor
member.summary: DarkColor used to draw Dark modules of the QrCode

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.LightColor
member.summary: LightColor used to draw Light modules and QuietZone of the QrCode. Setting to a transparent color (A = 0) allows transparent light modules so the QR Code blends in the existing background. In that case the existing background should remain light and rather uniform, and higher error correction levels are recommended.

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.EncapsulatedPostScriptRenderer.DrawingTechnique
member.summary: Selection of the technique used to draw the modules. 'Squares' draws vector squares one by one; 'Image' uses the 'image' or 'colorimage' PostScript command. 'Squares' supports transparency of light modules and often has smaller file size for color QR Codes. 'Image' might be faster to render on some devices as it is a single command.

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.FixedCodeSize.#ctor(System.Int32,Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.QuietZoneModules)
member.summary: FixedCodeSize is strategy for rendering QrCode at fixed Size.
member.param: Fixed size for QrCode pixel width. Pixel width have to be bigger than QrCode's matrix width(include quiet zone) QrCode matrix width is between 25 ~ 182(version 1 ~ 40).

member.name: M:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.FixedCodeSize.GetSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Interface function that use by Rendering class.
member.returns: Module pixel size and QrCode pixel width

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.FixedCodeSize.QrCodeWidth
member.summary: QrCodeWidth is pixel size of QrCode you would like to print out. It have to be greater than QrCode's matrix width(include quiet zone). QrCode matrix width is between 25 ~ 182(version 1 ~ 40).

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.FixedCodeSize.QuietZoneModules
member.summary: Number of quietZone modules

member.summary: FixedModuleSize is strategy for rendering QrCode with fixed module pixel size.

member.summary: Interface function that use by Rendering class.
member.returns: Module pixel size and QrCode pixel width

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.FixedModuleSize.ModuleSize
member.summary: Module pixel size. Have to greater than zero

member.name: P:Neos.IdentityServer.MultiFactor.QrEncoding.Windows.Render.FixedModuleSize.QuietZoneModules
member.summary: Number of quietZone modules

member.summary: Saves QrCode Image to specified stream in the specified format
member.remarks: You should avoid saving an image to the same stream that was used to construct. Doing so might damage the stream If any additional data has been written to the stream before saving the image, the image data in the stream will be corrupted
